name: Graduate Students in International Economics
body:
The GSIE seminar is jointly organized by Matthieu Crozet and Thierry Verdier with the assistance of Elsa Leromain and Julian Hinz.

This seminar is held on Mondays from 12:00 to 13:00 in room S19 (Behind the main building) at the Campus Maison des Sciences Economics.

***
###Upcoming Seminars:
* **June 30th, 2014 - MSE Room S19 (12:00-13:00)**
_Jamal Haidar (Paris School of Economics)_, "Sanctions and trade deflection".


###Previous Seminars:

* **May 19th, 2014 - MSE Room S19 (12:00-13:00)**
_Clément Nedoncelle (EQUIPPE - Université de Lille)_, "Real Exchange-Rate Volatility, Third Market Effect and Trade: Evidence from French Firm-level Data", with Jérôme Héricourt (EQUIPPE - Université de Lille, CEPII, Paris 1) 
[abstract](https://sites.google.com/site/gsieseminar/home/Nedoncelle.pdf?attredirects=0&d=1)

* **April 7th, 2014 - MSE Room S19 (12:00-13:00)**
_Anna Ray (Paris School of Economics - Paris 1)_, "Expanding Multinationals - Industry Relatedness and Conglomerate M&A".


* **March 24th, 2014 - MSE Room S19 (12:00-13:00)**
_Sophie Hatte (Université de Rouen - PSE)_, "It's not Who You Are, it's Who You Know: Political Connections and the Media Capture". 
[abstract](https://sites.google.com/site/gsieseminar/home/GSIE_HATTE.pdf?attredirects=0&d=1)

* **February 24th, 2014 - MSE Room S19 (12:00-13:00)**
_Anthony Edo (Paris School of Economics - Paris 1)_, "Minimum Wage and the Labor Market Effects of Migration: Evidence from France", with Farid Toubal (ENS, PSE, CESifo, CEPII). 
[abstract](https://sites.google.com/site/gsieseminar/home/Edo.pdf?attredirects=0&d=1)

* **February 10th, 2014 - MSE Room S19 (12:00-13:00)**
_Geoffrey Barrows (UC Berkeley, ARE)_, "Exporting and the environment: evidence from the end of the multi-fibre agreement", with Helene Ollivier (PSE - Paris 1) 
[abstract](https://sites.google.com/site/gsieseminar/home/Barrows.pdf?attredirects=0&d=1)

* **January 20th, 2014 - MSE Room S2 (12:00-13:00)**
_Brahim Boualam (Université de Génève)_, "Getting a first job: quality of the labor matching in French cities" 
[abstract](https://sites.google.com/site/gsieseminar/home/Boualam_2014_Abstract.pdf?attredirects=0&d=1)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
